title: Identifying Contaminated Water Sources in Chemical Areas
brief: How to recognize signs of chemical contamination in water sources before use.
steps: Step 1: Check for foreign odors: garlic, mustard, geranium, or bitter almond smells.
Step 2: Look for oily spots on water surface or nearby ground areas.
Step 3: Observe for presence of dead fish or animals in or near water source.
Step 4: If any contamination signs are present, do not use the water under any circumstances.
Step 5: Prefer sealed containers, then closed sources like underground pipes.
Step 6: Use rainwater or snow only if no evidence of contamination exists.
warnings: If contamination signs are present, water is unsafe regardless of treatment
Chemical agents can make water lethal even in small amounts
Slow-moving streams may still be contaminated - always check for signs first
